Ethnic group: "An ethnicity, or ethnic group, is a social group of people 
who identify with each other based on common ancestral, social, cultural, 
or national experience.[1][2] Membership of an ethnic group tends to be 
associated with shared cultural heritage, ancestry, history, homeland, 
language (dialect), or ideology, and with symbolic systems such as 
religion, mythology and ritual, cuisine, dressing style, physical 
appearance, etc."

Nation: "The concept of "nation" is related to "ethnic community" or 
ethnie. An ethnic community shares a common myth of origins and descent, a 
common history, elements of distinctive culture, a common territorial 
association, and sense of group solidarity. A nation is, by comparison, 
much more impersonal, abstract, and overtly political than an ethnic group. 
It is a cultural-political community that has become conscious of its 
coherence, unity, and particular interests.[1]"

So you can see that a nation is basically an ethnic group, with the 
difference that a nation has a country. An ethnic group - does not. And a 
people either has or wants a country.
